transportAdvice: Biarritz is a compact coastal town where the main beaches, shops, and attractions are easily walkable from the town center. A local bus network connects key areas including the beach districts and train station, and taxis are generally available, though a car is useful for exploring the wider Basque Country region.

weather.description: Cool and frequently rainy with Atlantic storms possible, but mild for winter by European standards.
Still wet and unsettled, though occasional sunny spells break through the cloud cover.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and longer days, with a mix of rain and sunshine.
Pleasant spring weather with warming temperatures, though showers remain common.
Warm and increasingly sunny, making it a good time to visit before summer crowds arrive.
Early summer is warm and mostly sunny, ideal for beach visits and outdoor dining.
Peak summer with warm, sunny days and lively beach atmosphere; the busiest tourist month.
Hot and sunny with excellent surf conditions; expect large crowds and high prices.
Warm and pleasant with fewer crowds, making it one of the best months to visit.
Autumn brings cooler temperatures and increasing rain, but the town retains a relaxed charm.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with Atlantic weather systems bringing frequent rain.
Cool and rainy with short days, though the town is quiet and the Basque Christmas markets add seasonal appeal.
